tool.name: MetaboLights Labs Uploader
tool.description: Uploads data to a user workspace's within the MetaboLights Labs staging area at the European Bioinformatics Institute (EBI).
tool.command: #if str( $input_type.input_type_selector) == "isa-tab": uploadToMetaboLightsLabs.py -t "$metabolights_labs_key" --I $isatab_input.extra_files_path --v $validation_report #else: ln -s "$maf_file" maf.zip; ln -s "$data_file" data.tar; ln -s "$isa_file" isa.zip; uploadToMetaboLightsLabs.py -t "$metabolights_labs_key" #if str( $maf_file ) != None: --i maf.zip data.tar isa.zip #else: --i data.tar isa.zip #end if #end if #if str( $labs_project_id ) != None and str( $create_new_project ) == "no": -p "$labs_project_id" #end if #if str( $create_new_project ) == "yes": -n #end if -s dev

param.name: metabolights_labs_key
param.label: MetaboLights Labs Key
param.help: You should get this from the MetaboLights Labs Website or the MetaboLights website (see help below)

param.name: data_file
param.label: TAR file containing RAW data files

param.name: maf_file
param.label: Zip file containing MAF files.
param.help: The MAF Zip file is optional

param.name: labs_project_id
param.label: Existing MetaboLights Labs Project ID
param.help: Enter the MetaboLights Labs Project ID if you want to add files to an existing project

tool.help:
**Overview**
A program to upload metabolomics data to MetaboLights Labs, previously to converting them to studies. The aim of the tool is to assist researchers in the deposition of metabolomics data into MetaboLights, by providing upload facilities for data and meta-data that should be part of a deposition, but that are not completely finalized to be directly deposited. The MetaboLights Labs interface provides the user with the ability to make necessary adjustments to go from those files uploaded to a properly formatted MetaboLights Study for deposition.
**How to get your MetaboLights Labs Key**
Go to https://wwwdev.ebi.ac.uk/metabolights, press on the login button to the top right (or create an account if you don't have one). Once logged in, in the section of account options, press the "My Account" button. In this new page you will see a form, scroll down to the bottom of it to find your MetaboLights API Key (it is the same key for Labs). Press the copy button to the right, which will add the key to your clipboard. You can paste it now in the MetaboLights Labs Key field in the Galaxy tool above.
